page.title: 02GENERAL INTRODUCTION FAWKHAM
page.content: In years gone by this Parish in the valley of Fawkhsm was a hop-growing area but owing to disease hop farming was discontinued. Even today hops can still be found growing wild in hedgerows. This is a very old area with a history of beautiful old Manor Houses, lovely parklands and old woods. Most of the Manor houses have been redeveloped and the area is now purely woods, rouugh scrubland and grazing land. Some farms have a few cowsd or shbut small new private developmentds are springing up over the parish, sadly,diversified, a sign of changed times, but still at its heart, is the old village green with a find but very ancient hostelry "The Rising Sun" mine host and his knowledgeable wife Sue and Joe Bradbnury relegate you with the history of the hostelery since l656.
